brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to pilot and feasibility test an innovative cognitive
      behavioral intervention to improve heart failure self-care among community dwelling older
      adults.The primary aim of this study is to test the effect of the intervention on improving
      heart failure self-care, knowledge and Health related quality of life at 1 month and 3
      months. We will test three hypotheses comparing 60 older adults with heart failure randomly
      assigned to either the intervention or a control group:

      Hypothesis 1. Participants in the intervention group will have significantly improved heart
      failure self-care than control participants.

      Hypothesis 2. Participants in the intervention group will have significantly improved
      knowledge about heart failure and heart failure self-care than control participants.

      Hypothesis 3. Participants in the intervention group will have significantly better Health
      Related Quality of Life than control participants.

      A secondary exploratory aim is to assess and describe implementation feasibility of
      providing a heart failure self-care intervention in a community group setting.

clinical_study.brief_title: Building Skill in Heart Failure Self-care: A Community Based Intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  diagnosis of chronic HF

          -  able to read and speak English or Spanish

          -  over age 50

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  history of prior neurological event (e.g., stroke, head injury, encephalopathy) that
             could cause dementia

          -  unable to perform tests or participate in the intervention session (e.g., inability
             to communicate verbally, major visual impairment, or severe and uncorrected hearing
             loss).

          -  living in a nursing home or other long term care facility

clinical_study.official_title: Building Skill in Heart Failure Self-Care: A Community Based Intervention

other_outcome.description: Health related quality of life will be measured using valid and reliable Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire. Changes in scores will be assessed from baseline to 3 months
other_outcome.measure: Changes in baseline Health related quality of life at 1 month
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes in baseline health related quality of life at 1 month

other_outcome.description: Health related quality of life will be measured using valid and reliable Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire. Changes in scores will be assessed from baseline to 3 months
other_outcome.measure: Changes in baseline Health related quality of life at 3 month
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes in baseline health related quality of life at 3 month

overall_official.last_name: Victoria Vaughan Dickson, PhD, RN, FAHA

primary_outcome.description: Heart failure self-care is measured by the valid and reliable instrument the Self-Care of Heart Failure Index. Change in scores from baseline at one month will be assessed.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline heart failure self-care score at one month
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline heart failure self-care at 1 month

primary_outcome.description: Heart failure self-care is measured by the valid and reliable instrument the Self-Care of Heart Failure Index. Change in scores from baseline to 3 months will be assessed.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline heart failure self-care score at 3 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline heart failure self-care at 3 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Heart failure knowledge will be measured using the valid and reliable Dutch Heart Failure Knowledge survey. Changes in total score from baseline at 1 month will be assessed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline Heart failure knowledge score at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in baseline Heart failure knowledge score at 1 month

secondary_outcome.description: Heart failure knowledge will be measured using the valid and reliable Dutch Heart Failure Knowledge survey. Changes in total heart failure knowledge score from baseline to 3 months will be assessed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline Heart failure knowledge score at 3 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in baseline Heart failure knowledge score at 3 month

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine
